intro: Silene nocteolens, commonly known as the night-flowering catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its striking, pink to purple flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats like meadows and roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Silene nocteolens is a herbaceous perennial that blooms from late summer into early autumn.
